Class summary: Engine: Manages lifecycle and execution of an inference engine, handling initialization, loading, activation, buffer allocation, inference calls, and engine configuration.

Standalone functions: device_view (simple helper), make_beta_schedule (no details), make_ddim_sampling_parameters (unused), make_ddim_timesteps (no details), noise_like (simple helper).

Thus file is about TensorRT engine utilities for NeRF (Neural Radiance Fields) module in multimodal collection. It provides a wrapper class to load and run TensorRT engine, plus helper functions for device view and noise generation, and schedule creation.

We need to produce summary: describe responsibilities: provide utilities to load TensorRT engine from serialized bytes, manage buffers, execute inference, configure engine, and helper functions for device tensors and noise generation.

Business intent: accelerate neural rendering (NeRF) inference using TensorRT for high-performance deployment, enabling fast inference in multimodal AI applications.

Keywords: TensorRT, inference engine, NeRF, NVIDIA, CUDA, engine loading, buffer management, inference execution, schedule generation, noise generation, PyTorch integration, polygraphy, high-performance inference.
